edu.uci.ics.luci.lucicabinet

All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.Map<K,V>
public class LUCICabinetBDB<K extends java.io.Serializable,V extends java.io.Serializable>
extends LUCICabinetMap<K,V>

This is a class which creates a synchronized (thread-safe) key-value store backed by a tokyo cabinet B-Tree Database (BDB). K is the key type V is the value type

Constructor Detail

LUCICabinetBDB

public LUCICabinetBDB(java.lang.String filePathAndName,
                      boolean optimize)
Open the database stored at the filePathName indicated. If the file doesn't exist it will be created. The file will be write locked while open by the file system. If the file is not closed the underlying database will be damaged. If the database is "optimized" then put and removes will be non-blocking and will always return null. This is a violation of the java Map contract, but cuts the database operations in half.

Parameters:
filePathAndName - The name of the file to open, e.g."eraseme.tcb"
optimize - if true, then the database will always return null for put and remove operations

                                   IteratorWorkerConfig iwConfig)
                                                                                      throws java.lang.InstantiationException,

Iterate over the entries in the database and call the appropriate methods in iwClass to do work. See IteratorWorker for details on how the iteration works.
